monogr.title: Compendium belli: or the touchstone of martiall discipline : VVherein is set foorth briefe rules and directions to take speciall notice of. The next of marches, exercising of a company, ordering of muskaters, imbattelling from 100. vnto 40000. The forme of encamping, with briefe notes belonging therevnto: plots of fortifications and forts: with the manner of lading and blowing off great ordnance, making of granados. Also shewing the extraction of the square roote, witha table from 16. vnto 10000. Likewise certaine questions of arithmaticke concerning military discipline: with a table also for the discouering of numbers by rancke and file. Witten [sic] by Iohn Roberts of Weston neere Bath, gent
monogr.author: Roberts, John, of Weston

div.head: To all Gentlemen and Louers of the Art of Warre.
div.p:
NOble and ingenious Reader, I haue presented to the world, and to thy viewe this Compendium, that thou with it mayest reape, that only, by thy intuitiue speculation, which I haue got by my laborious practise: I make no doubt, of thy skill and knowledge herein, but that thou knowest, and hast seen, this in thine owne practicke, by thy industrious trauell; Which now thou seest here in the Theoricke, by my laborious paines. Therefore I desire your courteous censure in the perusall of this Booke: for if any thing be mistaken through equiuocation of words, or ambiguitie of sense, blame the fruitlesse rage of Destiny, that carries the best shafts of my vnlucky Quiuer farr distant from the white I aymed at. I did it
for the honour of my Countrey, and the generall good of the common weale: for which reasons, I hope it may passe without the molestation of any of the vnskilfull: The Learned and Ingenious I honor; and willingly stand to their censure; To the rest
